(43) 54.February 16, 1943.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND key it is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document war CABINET.PRIORITIES FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT.Note by the Prime Minister.IT has been suggested to me that it would help Departments in determiningpriorities for research and development if an indication were given of theprobable duration of the war.To this end I annex a draft directive. This draft has been circulated semi-officially to the Ministers directly concerned, and I understand that it is generally acceptable, although two of the Ministers consulted suggest that the date under (a)should be the middle of 1945 rather than the end of 1944.Subject to consideration by my colleagues, I suggest that the draft directiveshould now be approved, and that arrangements should be made for it to bebrought up for review every three months.The issue of the directive is, of course, only intended to provide general guidance to those responsible for determining priorities for research and develop-nient, and specific directions should continue to be sought from Ministers inparticular cases of difficulty.W. S. c.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,February 16, 1943.[25003][p.t.o. Draft Directive.In considering the priorities for research and development in the various departments. Ministers should, for the present, proceed on the following workingbasis : (ft) That. although no one ran tell when the war against Hitler will end, areasonable assumption at this date would be before the end of 1944.(b) That the war against Japan may well continue until the end of 1940. andmay require quite a large effort from this country.These dates will he subject to review every three months.
